page.title: 18HUMSHAUGH LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: THE{BORDER RALILWAY}LINE RAN THROUGH THE AREA FOR JUST UNDER A CENTURY CLOSING IN 1956 BY WHICH TIME THE MAIN TRANSPORT WAS BUSES AND CARS. STATIONS ARE NOW PLEASANT HOUSES, FEW HAVE BEEN NEGLECTED AND HUMSHAUGH STATION, NOW THE BEECHING, IS A GOOD EXAMPLE. THE ARCHITECT OF{CHOLLERTON VIADUCT COMMITTED SUICIDE ON THE EVE BEFORE OPENING, THINKING HIS VIADUCT WOULD COLLAPSE. BY THE ROADSIDE NEAR KEEPERSHIELD FARM IS AN ANCIENT MONUMENT, NOT IN USE NOW BUT ORIGINALLY USED TO WATER HORSES TRAVELLING BETWEEN BELLINGHAM AND HEXHAM. THE{ROMAN CAMP}OVER BY WALWICK FELL HAS NOT BEEN EXCAVATED. THE FIELDS IN THE AREA ARE USUALLY BORDERED BY DRY{STONE WALLS}WHICH ARE WELL MAINTAINED.
